snippet: Gov. Jay Nixon of Missouri said that the situation had “greatly improved.” In Washington, federal prosecutors face obstacles bringing civil rights charges in the shooting of Michael Brown.
abstract: Missouri Gov Jay Nixon orders Missouri National Guard to begin withdrawal from Ferguson, Mo; move follows two nights of calm and signals belief that order has largely been restored after nearly two weeks of unrest set off by police shooting of unarmed teenager Michael Brown.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN, MATT APUZZO and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Julie Bosman reported from Ferguson, Matt Apuzzo from Washington, and Marc Santora from New York. Frances Robles and Joseph Goldstein contributed reporting from Ferguson, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Jay Nixon of Missouri said that the situation had “greatly improved.” In Washington, federal prosecutors face obstacles bringing civil rights charges in the shooting of Michael Brown.

headline.main: National Guard Is Pulling Out of Ferguson as Tensions Ease
headline.print_headline: National Guard Is Pulling Out of Ferguson as Tensions Ease
